post: What happens when we deprioritize civics in American schools – and what is it going to take to drive meaningful change? These are some of the questions Bill of Rights Institute President and CEO David Bobb tackles in his latest op-ed, "Do they even teach civics anymore?" Civic education provides students the unique opportunity to understand how our nation and communities function and their roles in civil society,  he writes. All students deserve this knowledge, not just some students.  Read more here,  https://lnkd.in/gR7jqQz4  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #civiceducation

Recently, Rachel Humphries, BRI's Senior Director, Civic Learning Intitiaitves, spoke with Dave the Scholarship Coach, about the the contest. Constitution Day is today  and the Bill of Rights Institute featured a star-studded lineup for its annual Constitution Day Live! educational programming. This years theme is Built for This: Debate, Dialogue, & the Constitution.  BRI staff explored how our Constitutional system helps us navigate the disagreements that naturally emerge in a free society. With interviews with Condoleeza Rice, former U. S. Secretary of State and now the director of the Hoover Institution at Stanford University, Jane Kamensky, president and CEO of Monticello, Eric Meyer, editor and publisher of the Marion County Record, and author and scholar Yuval Levin, you wont want to miss it!  https://lnkd.in/ebkF728B  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #ConstitutionDayLive

Recently, retired Army Major Gerald Gangaram joined Larry Zilliox, host of Welcome Home: A Podcast for Veterans, About Veterans, By Veterans. Gangaram's work with BRI underscores the importance of civic education and fostering better citizenship among future generations. As election season approaches, it can be an exciting opportunity for civic education, but it can also bring stress and anxiety, especially for students engaging in political discussions for the first time. The Bill of Rights Institute has partnered with Huddle Up, an expert in IEP therapy, SEL, and K-12 mental health services, to provide free downloadable resources, including regulation cards, breathing visuals, and break cards that educators can share with students navigating election stress. To access and download Huddle Up's free resources for managing election stress, visit  https://lnkd.in/e94EbExS  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #mentalhealth

Washington teacher Shari Conditt has been named Bill of Rights Institute National Civics Teacher of the Year! Thousands of Washington students have learned about Americas history, founding principles, and their rights and responsibilities as citizens in Shari Conditts classroom. Now, Conditt is being honored nationally for her exceptional work on behalf of Americas young people. The award, which was presented to Conditt by representatives from the Bill of Rights Institute and SmartPass at a surprise school assembly on September 10, comes with a $5,000 top prize. SmartPass, a leading provider of digital hall pass technology used by thousands of schools nationwide to increase student accountability and foster better outcomes, has joined the Bill of Rights Institute to help sponsor this years contest and awards. To read more, visit  https://lnkd.in/ewJHDkVq.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #NationalCivicsTeacheroftheYear

And we will prioritize free speech and make sure diverse viewpoints are always welcome.
